summary: This document is a chain of emails from July 2020 between a U.S. Attorney's Office and defense attorney Glen McGorty regarding an ongoing investigation. The prosecutors seek to ask McGorty's client (referred to as 'Mr. [redacted]') about a U.S. Customs and Border Protection employee named [redacted] who may have been friends with Jeffrey Epstein in the Virgin Islands. The emails discuss scheduling a call and sharing a photo for identification.

persons.name: Glen McGorty
persons.context: Attorney at Crowell & Moring LLP representing a client ('Mr. [redacted]') who is being asked by prosecutors to identify an individual connected to Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Daniel Zelenko
persons.context: Copied on the email correspondence, appears to be part of the legal team involved.

persons.name: Danielle Giffuni
persons.context: Copied on the email correspondence, appears to be part of the legal team involved.

persons.name: Donnie Murrell
persons.context: A criminal defense attorney (Lary Donald 'Donnie' Murrell, Jr.) who was previously contacted in August 2019 regarding scheduling a meeting with prosecutors about an investigation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as the individual with whom a U.S. Customs and Border Protection employee may have had a friendship in the Virgin Islands.

connections.description: McGorty is the attorney representing the unnamed client ('Mr. [redacted]') who prosecutors want to question about an Epstein associate.
The unnamed U.S. Customs and Border Protection employee may have had a friendship with Epstein, visited his Virgin Islands home, and accompanied him on boat, helicopter, and/or plane trips.
Prosecutors believe the CBP employee may have introduced one or more individuals to McGorty's client ('Mr. [redacted]') at a bar or other location in the Virgin Islands.

events.title: Prosecutors Provide Additional Information on Epstein Associate
events.description: Prosecutors email defense attorney Glen McGorty with additional details about a U.S. Customs and Border Protection employee to see if it jogs his client's memory.

events.title: Discussion of Photo Identification
events.description: McGorty emails prosecutors to schedule a call and states they will let them know if his client recognizes an individual in a photo.

events.title: Previous Attempt to Schedule Meeting
events.description: Email exchange from August 2019 shows prosecutors and attorney Donnie Murrell were trying to schedule a meeting regarding an investigation for the week of August 19, 2019.

keyFacts: Prosecutors were investigating a U.S. Customs and Border Protection (CBP) employee who worked in Saint Thomas and may have been friends with Jeffrey Epstein.
The CBP employee had been to Epstein's home in the Virgin Islands and accompanied him on boat, helicopter, and/or plane trips.
The CBP employee was listed as a contact in Epstein's phone and may have introduced individuals to the attorney's client in the Virgin Islands.
The correspondence shows an ongoing investigation in July 2020 where prosecutors were using defense attorneys as intermediaries to question their clients about Epstein associates.
The emails reference 'crazy times' and 'recent developments' in the U.S. Attorney's Office, likely alluding to internal turmoil or external pressures.
